tutorial_general_talk_01/2701_0701_0100_:
Did you know that every sync pair has a type
that it’s weak against? It’s a scientific fact!
tutorial_general_talk_01/2701_0701_0200_:
Before you depart on a journey or task, I highly
recommend that you check the area’s weakness
type and edit your team accordingly!
tutorial_general_talk_01/2701_0702_0100_:
Using attacks of that weakness type will inflict
even greater damage than normal, you see!
tutorial_general_talk_01/2701_0702_0200_:
They’re super effective! Remember to adjust for
weaknesses. You won’t regret it! The results
will speak for themselves.
tutorial_general_talk_01/2704_0701_0100_:
Pssst! I’ve got a tip that’ll help you take down
tough opponents! It’s about switching targets...
tutorial_general_talk_01/2704_0701_0200_:
The more opponents you have battling against you
at once, the harder it is to defeat them, right?
tutorial_general_talk_01/2704_0701_0300_:
Well, if you target the weaker sync pairs first,
you can take them off the board faster!
Once you do that, winning is a breeze!
tutorial_general_talk_01/2704_0702_0100_:
Then again, sometimes it’s better to go for the
strongest sync pair first, depending on the
situation. Use your best judgment!
tutorial_general_talk_01/2704_0702_0200_:
Either way, switching targets can be a
superhelpful strategy!
tutorial_general_talk_01/2706_0701_0100_:
Oww! That s-stings...
I was petting my friend’s Infernape, and I
accidentally burned my hand...
tutorial_general_talk_01/2706_0701_0200_:
Did you know that Pokémon can get burned, too?
They can also be poisoned, paralyzed, frozen,
and put to sleep.
tutorial_general_talk_01/2706_0702_0100_:
We call these status conditions. Switching out your
Pokémon isn’t enough to heal them, so be careful.
tutorial_general_talk_01/2706_0702_0200_:
Ow-ow-ow! Man, this burn really does hurt...
If only it would heal automatically after a battle,
like my Pokémon...
tutorial_general_talk_01/2709_0701_0100_:
“After you use a sync move, the amount of
damage your team inflicts will increase...”
tutorial_general_talk_01/2709_0701_0200_:
Oops! Sorry...was I talking out loud?
I’m trying to memorize everything I’ve learned
about sync moves, but they’re so complicated!
tutorial_general_talk_01/2709_0702_0100_:
Apparently, the opposing team in a battle can use
their own sync moves, too.
tutorial_general_talk_01/2709_0702_0200_:
Man, it’s tough memorizing all of this! It might
be better to go out and do lots of battling to
build up muscle memory instead!
tutorial_general_talk_01/2710_0701_0100_:
The abbreviation “PML” gets thrown around 
quite a bit, doesn’t it?
Do you remember what it stands for?
tutorial_general_talk_01/2710_0701_0200_:
It’s short for “Pokémon Masters League”—
the tournament currently being held here on Pasio.
tutorial_general_talk_01/2710_0702_0100_:
“P” for “Pokémon,” “M” for “Masters,” and “L” for
“League!” See? It’s quite simple to remember!
